æ¼æ´ç±»å‹ï¼š é…ç½®é—®é¢˜

æ¼æ´ç­‰çº§ï¼š ä¸¥é‡

æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š Apache HTTP Serverä¸­å­˜åœ¨ä¸€ä¸ªä¸¥é‡çš„SSL/TLSè¯ä¹¦éªŒè¯ç»•è¿‡æ¼æ´ï¼ˆCVE-2024-40898ï¼‰ï¼Œåœ¨æŸäº›é”™è¯¯é…ç½®ä¸‹å¯èƒ½å…è®¸ç»•è¿‡SSL/TLSè¯ä¹¦éªŒè¯ã€‚è¯¥æ¼æ´é€šè¿‡å‘ç›®æ ‡æœåŠ¡å™¨å‘èµ·SSLè¿æ¥å¹¶å‘é€HEADè¯·æ±‚æ¥æ£€æµ‹ã€‚å¦‚æœå“åº”è¡¨æ˜SSLè¯ä¹¦éªŒè¯å¤„ç†ä¸å½“ï¼Œåˆ™æœåŠ¡å™¨å¯èƒ½æ˜“å—æ”»å‡»ã€‚

äº§å“å‚å•†ï¼š Apache

äº§å“åç§°ï¼š Apache HTTP Server

æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/anilpatel199n/CVE-2024-40898

ç±»å‹ï¼š CVE-2024:github search

ä»“åº“æ–‡ä»¶

  • CVE-2024-40898 .py
  • README.md

æ¥æºæ¦‚è¿°

CVE-2024-40898

This Python script checks for the presence of CVE-2024-40898, a critical vulnerability in Apache HTTP Server that may allow SSL/TLS certificate verification bypass under certain misconfigurations. It initiates an SSL connection to the target server and sends a HEAD request.

It initiates an SSL connection to the target server and sends a HEAD request. If the response suggests that SSL certificate verification is improperly handled, the server might be vulnerable.

ğŸš€ Features
âœ… Supports full URLs or plain IPs with optional ports

âœ… Automatically parses and defaults to port 443 if not specified

âœ… Ignores SSL certificate errors (for test purposes)

âœ… Minimal and fast detection logic

âœ… Clear output indicating possible vulnerability

ğŸ›  Usage
python CVE-2024-40898.py -u https://192.168.1.1:443
You can also just pass an IP:

python CVE-2024-40898.py -u 192.168.1.1
âš ï¸ Disclaimer
This script is for educational and authorized security testing only. Do not use on systems you do not own or have explicit permission to test.

entry.title: The Image Resizer On The Fly plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to arbitrary file deletion due to
entry.content:
é“¾æ¥ï¼š https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-gxqj-2gvr-3p2f

CVSS è¯„åˆ†ï¼š 9.1

å‚è€ƒé“¾æ¥ï¼š

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-6065

  • https://plugins.trac.wordpress.org/browser/image-resizer-on-the-fly/trunk/image-resizer-on-the-fly.php#L25

  • https://wordpress.org/plugins/image-resizer-on-the-fly

  • https://www.wordfence.com/threat-intel/vulnerabilities/id/14877ff6-e393-41a3-91c1-fe7f477297cc?source=cve

  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-gxqj-2gvr-3p2f

æè¿°ï¼š

The Image Resizer On The Fly plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to arbitrary file deletion due to insufficient file path validation in the â€˜deleteâ€™ task in all versions up to, and including, 1.1. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to delete arbitrary files on the server, which can easily lead to remote code execution when the right file is deleted (such as wp-config.php).

æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š Microsoft SharePoint å­˜åœ¨ä¸€ä¸ªè¿œç¨‹ä»£ç æ‰§è¡Œæ¼æ´ï¼ŒåŸå› æ˜¯æœªèƒ½æ£€æŸ¥åº”ç”¨ç¨‹åºåŒ…çš„æºæ ‡è®°ï¼Œå…è®¸è¿œç¨‹æ”»å‡»è€…é€šè¿‡å‘é€æ¶æ„çš„åº”ç”¨ç¨‹åºåŒ…æ‰§è¡Œä»»æ„ä»£ç ã€‚

äº§å“å‚å•†ï¼š Microsoft

äº§å“åç§°ï¼š SharePoint

æœç´¢è¯­æ³•ï¼š cpe:â€cpe:2.3:a:microsoft:sharepoint_serverâ€

æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/projectdiscovery/nuclei-templates/issues/12340

ç±»å‹ï¼š projectdiscovery/nuclei-templates:github issues

æ¥æºæ¦‚è¿°

Description:

Microsoft SharePoint contains a remote code execution caused by failure to check the source markup of an application package, letting remote attackers execute arbitrary code, exploit requires sending malicious application package.

Severity: Critical
POC:
  • https://github.com/davidlebr1/cve-2019-0604-SP2010-netv3.5
  • https://vulncheck.com/xdb/b321302986c1
  • https://github.com/Gh0st0ne/weaponized-0604
  • https///github.com:Gh0st0ne/weaponized-0604.git
  • https://github.com/boxhg/CVE-2019-0604
  • https://github.com/m5050/CVE-2019-0604
  • https://vulncheck.com/xdb/cca6def6980c
  • https://github.com/k8gege/CVE-2019-0604
  • https///github.com:k8gege/CVE-2019-0604.git
  • https://github.com/likekabin/CVE-2019-0604_sharepoint_CVE
  • https://github.com/linhlhq/CVE-2019-0604

KEV: True

Shodan Query: cpe:"cpe:2.3:a:microsoft:sharepoint_server"

Acceptance Criteria: The template must include a complete POC and should not rely solely on version-based detection. Contributors are required to provide debug data(-debug) along with the template to help the triage team with validation or can also share a vulnerable environment like docker file.

Rewards will only be given once the template is fully validated by the team. Templates that are incomplete or invalid will not be accepted. Avoid adding code templates for CVEs that can be achieved using HTTP, TCP, or JavaScript. Such templates are blocked by default and wonâ€™t produce results, so we prioritize creating templates with other protocols unless exceptions are made.

You can check the FAQ for the Nuclei Templates Community Rewards Program here.

entry.title: Online Appointment Booking System Reflected XSS Vulnerability
entry.content:
æ¼æ´ä¿¡æ¯

æ¼æ´åç§°ï¼š Online Appointment Booking System Reflected XSS Vulnerability

æ¼æ´ç¼–å·ï¼š

  • CVEï¼š CVE-2025-46181

æ¼æ´ç±»å‹ï¼š è·¨ç«™å¯æ‰§è¡Œè„šæœ¬

æ¼æ´ç­‰çº§ï¼š ä¸­å±

æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š åœ¨çº¿é¢„çº¦é¢„è®¢ç³»ç»Ÿ(v1.0)ä¸­å­˜åœ¨åå°„å‹è·¨ç«™è„šæœ¬(XSS)æ¼æ´ï¼Œç‰¹åˆ«æ˜¯åœ¨å¤„ç†é¢„çº¦ç¡®è®¤çš„é¡µé¢ä¸­ã€‚ä¸€ä¸ªGETå‚æ•°æœªèƒ½æ­£ç¡®æ¸…ç†è¾“å…¥ï¼Œä½¿å¾—å¯ä»¥åœ¨å—å®³è€…çš„æµè§ˆå™¨ä¸­æ³¨å…¥å¹¶æ‰§è¡ŒJavaScriptä»£ç ã€‚

äº§å“åç§°ï¼š Online Appointment Booking System

å½±å“ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼š v1.0

æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/shemkumar/CVE-2025-46181-XSS

ç±»å‹ï¼š CVE-2025:github search

ä»“åº“æ–‡ä»¶

  • DISCLAIMER.md
  • LICENSE
  • README.md
  • poc.py

æ¥æºæ¦‚è¿°

CVE-2025-46181 - Reflected XSS in an Online Appointment Booking System

CVE-ID: CVE-2025-46181
Discovered by: Shemkumar P (shemkumar.github.io)
Vulnerability Type: Reflected Cross-Site Scripting (XSS)
Severity: Medium
Status: Disclosed, CVE Assigned by MITRE

âœ¨ Description

A Reflected Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability exists in a public online appointment booking system (v1.0), specifically in the page that handles appointment confirmation. A GET parameter fails to sanitize input properly, enabling JavaScript injection and code execution in the victimâ€™s browser.

ğŸ“ Vulnerable Parameter

Example Payload (Encoded):

ğŸ’¥ Proof of Concept (PoC)

ğŸš« Live link redacted for ethical reasons. This vulnerability was tested in a controlled environment.

âš™ï¸ Python PoC Script

ğŸ›¡ï¸ Impact

  • Arbitrary JavaScript execution
  • Potential session hijacking
  • Clickjacking or phishing redirection
  • Targeted attacks through crafted links

ğŸ§ª Remediation

The application should:

  • Escape user inputs using htmlspecialchars() in PHP
  • Use a Content Security Policy (CSP)
  • Sanitize user data at both client and server sides

ğŸ“œ Timeline

  • Discovered: May 2025
  • CVE Assigned by MITRE: June 2025
  • Public Release: June 2025

ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ’» Author

Shemkumar P
ğŸ•¸ï¸ shemkumar.github.io
ğŸ” Cybersecurity Researcher | CTF Enthusiast | CVE Reporter

âš ï¸ This publication is for educational and defensive use only. Testing or exploiting vulnerabilities on systems you donâ€™t own or have explicit permission for is illegal and unethical.

æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š è¿œç¨‹æ¡Œé¢æœåŠ¡ï¼ˆä»¥å‰ç§°ä¸ºç»ˆç«¯æœåŠ¡ï¼‰åŒ…å«ä¸€ä¸ªè¿œç¨‹ä»£ç æ‰§è¡Œæ¼æ´ï¼Œç”±æœªç»è®¤è¯çš„æ”»å‡»è€…é€šè¿‡RDPå‘é€ç‰¹åˆ¶è¯·æ±‚å¼•èµ·ï¼Œå…è®¸è¿œç¨‹æ”»å‡»è€…æ‰§è¡Œä»»æ„ä»£ç ã€‚åˆ©ç”¨æ­¤æ¼æ´éœ€è¦ç½‘ç»œè®¿é—®RDPç«¯å£ã€‚

æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/projectdiscovery/nuclei-templates/issues/12278

æ¥æºæ¦‚è¿°

Description:

Remote Desktop Services (formerly Terminal Services) contains a remote code execution caused by specially crafted requests sent over RDP by unauthenticated attackers, letting remote attackers execute arbitrary code, exploit requires network access to RDP port.

Severity: Critical
POC:
  • http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/153133/Microsoft-Windows-Remote-Desktop-BlueKeep-Denial-Of-Service.html
  • http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/153627/Microsoft-Windows-RDP-BlueKeep-Denial-Of-Service.html
  • http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/154579/BlueKeep-RDP-Remote-Windows-Kernel-Use-After-Free.html
  • http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/162960/Microsoft-RDP-Remote-Code-Execution.html
  • https///github.com:jinshengsoul/Exploit-factory.git
  • https://github.com/isabelacostaz/CVE-2019-0708-POC
  • https://github.com/hualy13/CVE-2019-0708-Check
  • https://github.com/DenuwanJayasekara/CVE-Exploitation-Reports
  • https://github.com/adyanamul/Remote-Code-Execution-RCE-Exploit-BlueKeep-CVE-2019-0708-PoC
  • https://github.com/rasan2001/Microsoft-Remote-Desktop-Services-Remote-Code-Execution-Vulnerability-CVE-2019-0708

KEV: True

Shodan Query: cpe:"cpe:2.3:o:microsoft:windows_7"

Acceptance Criteria: The template must include a complete POC and should not rely solely on version-based detection. Contributors are required to provide debug data(-debug) along with the template to help the triage team with validation or can also share a vulnerable environment like docker file.

Rewards will only be given once the template is fully validated by the team. Templates that are incomplete or invalid will not be accepted. Avoid adding code templates for CVEs that can be achieved using HTTP, TCP, or JavaScript. Such templates are blocked by default and wonâ€™t produce results, so we prioritize creating templates with other protocols unless exceptions are made.

You can check the FAQ for the Nuclei Templates Community Rewards Program here.
